question:
Hi, I have a question about practice midterm question.
I finished my data template for Word star
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
@htdd WorldStar)
(define-struct wstar (rot col))
;; Star is (make-wstar Integer UniColor)
;; interp. the state of a star, where
;;         rot is the angle of rotation in degrees
;;         col is the color of the star
(define WS1 (make-wstar 0   "white"))
(define WS2 (make-wstar 90  "orange"))
;; TASK 1: Complete the Data Definition for WorldStar
(@dd-template-rules compound ;(make-wstar Integer UniColor)
                    ref) ;UniColor
(define (fn-for-worldstar w)
  (... (wstar-rot w)
       (fn-for-unicolor (wstar-col w))))
------------------------------------------------
Since it has a reference (make-wstar Integer UniColor)
I add another function for unicolor in front of (wstar-col w)
but, as I went through other tasks below 
it looks like I dont need the fn-for-unicolor  for  function "spin" and "render" which I had brought the template from WorldStar
---------------------------------------------
(define (spin w)
  (make-wstar (+ (wstar-rot w) SPEED)
              (wstar-col w)))
(define (render w)
  (place-image (rotate (wstar-rot w) (star LEN MODE (wstar-col w)))
               CTR-X CTR-Y MTS))
-------------------------------------------
However I found that keyevent function actually needs it.
(define (handle-key ws ke)
  (cond [(key=? ke "c") (make-wstar (wstar-rot ws)
                                    (change-color (wstar-col ws)))]
        [else ws]))
as far as i know , mouse and keyevent, they have their own template.
1) Can i delete the dd template if i decide not to use it? 
(here is  fn-for-unicolor)
2) do i have to rely on my intuition where to use fn-for-unicolor?
(keyevent function clearly doesnt have template for fn-for-unicolor :( )
Thank you!
instructor_answer:
refer to http://cs110.students.cs.ubc.ca/recipe-elements-schedule.html
regarding the @dd-template-rules
"I add another function for unicolor in front of (wstar-col w)" good, since we make use of the reference rule here.
(wstar-col w) is UniColor, a non-primitive datatype, hence we need a single function/selector that precedes (wstar-col).
